**DELIVERYNOW SYSTEM CHANGE REQUEST FORM**

**Change Request ID:** DN-00432
**Date:** 15/09/2022

**1. System/Application Being Changed:**
DeliveryNow Driver Payment System (DPS)

**2. Business Justification:**
The current DPS does not efficiently handle the increasing volume of transactions. This change aims to enhance the system's scalability and performance to accommodate our growing driver community.

**3. Technical Details of the Change:**
- Modification of the database schema to improve query performance
- Implementation of a more robust transaction handling mechanism
- Optimization of the codebase for better performance

**4. Impact Assessment:**
- Temporary unavailability of the DPS during off-peak hours
- Improved system performance and reduced transaction handling time
- Enhanced driver satisfaction due to prompt and efficient payment processing

**5. Testing Plan and Results:**
- Unit testing for individual functions
- Integration testing for the entire system
- Load testing to simulate the high volume of transactions

**Test Results:** 
The tests were successful with minor issues that have been resolved. Detailed test results are available upon request.

**6. Approval Signatures:**
- Technical Approval: ________________ (CTO/Lead Developer)
- Business Approval: ________________ (CFO/Finance Head)

**7. Implementation Date:** 25/09/2022
**Rollback Procedures:** In case of any system malfunction, the changes will be rolled back to the previous stable version (v.2.3.1) of the DPS. A full backup of the current system will be taken before the change implementation.

**Note:** Secondary approvals and complete testing documentation will be provided before the implementation date.

---

**FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY**

**Change Coordinator:** _______________________
**Date Received:** _______________________

**Change Advisory Board Review:**
- Technical Feasibility: Approved/Not Approved
- Business Impact: Approved/Not Approved

**Final Decision:** Approved/Not Approved
**Date:** _________

---

Please return completed form to the IT Change Management Team, DeliveryNow.

| 13/02/2023 | Financial Reporting  | Completed      | 03:25 AM        | 402 GB        | Passed          |
| 14/02/2023 | Payment System       | Completed      | 02:00 AM        | 258 GB        | Passed          |
| 14/02/2023 | Customer Data System | Completed      | 02:50 AM        | 604 GB        | Passed          |
| 14/02/2023 | Financial Reporting  | Completed      | 03:30 AM        | 403 GB        | Passed          |

---

#### **Failed Backup Notifications:**

- Financial Reporting System backups failed on February 8, 9, 10, and 11 due to database connection issues.
- Customer Data System backups failed on February 10 and 12 due to storage capacity limitations on the backup server.

---

#### **Offsite Backup Transfer Status:**

All offsite backup transfers completed successfully except for the Financial Reporting System on February 8, 9, 10, and 11 and the Customer Data System on February 10 and 12, which correspond to the local backup failures.

---

#### **Recovery Testing Results:**

All recovery testing passed for backups that completed successfully. Testing failed for Financial Reporting System on February 8, 9, 10, and 11 and Customer Data System on February 10 and 12 due to absence of backup files.

---

#### **System Administrator Review and Sign-off:**

The failed backups on the Financial Reporting System and Customer Data System have been identified and necessary actions are being taken to resolve these issues. We are working on re-establishing the database connection for the Financial Reporting System and expanding storage capacity for backup servers to handle larger data from the Customer Data System.

---

**John Doe, System Administrator, FinanceFirst**
**Date: February 15, 2023**

**PAYFLOW TECH**

        **ACCESS REVIEW REPORT**

        **Report Date**: 06/30/2022

        **Review Period**: Q2 2022 (April 1, 2022 - June 30, 2022)

        ---
        
        **USER DETAILS**

        | User ID | Name           | Role                  | Access Level | Last Login Date | Manager Approval |
        |---------|----------------|-----------------------|--------------|-----------------|------------------|
        | PF001   | Smith, John    | Lead Software Engineer| Admin        | 06/25/2022      | Not Approved     |
        | PF002   | Doe, Jane      | Data Analyst          | User         | 06/28/2022      | Approved         |
        | PF003   | Johnson, Carol | Project Manager       | User         | 06/27/2022      | Not Approved     |
        | PF004   | Rodriguez, Tom | HR Manager            | User         | 06/26/2022      | Not Approved     |
        | PF005   | Chen, Lily     | Financial Analyst     | User         | 06/29/2022      | Approved         |
        | PF006   | Davis, Emma    | Software Engineer     | User         | 06/28/2022      | Not Approved     |
        | PF007   | Taylor, David  | Product Manager       | User         | 06/25/2022      | Approved         |
        | PF008   | Brown, Alice   | QA Engineer           | User         | 06/27/2022      | Not Approved     |
        | PF009   | Miller, Bob    | Network Administrator | Admin        | 06/30/2022      | Approved         |
        | PF010   | Wilson, Mary   | Data Scientist        | User         | 06/29/2022      | Not Approved     |
        | PF011   | Lee, Richard   | DevOps Engineer       | Admin        | 06/26/2022      | Approved         |
        | PF012   | Garcia, Nancy  | Compliance Officer    | User         | 06/28/2022      | Not Approved     |

        ---
        
        **FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS**
        
        1. **Critical Failures**: It has been found that there is a significant lack of managerial approval concerning access rights for employees. This negligence can lead to unauthorized access and misuse of the system. Immediate action is required to rectify this issue.

        2. **Access Levels**: Some roles have been assigned inappropriate access levels. Specifically, the Lead Software Engineer (PF001) and the DevOps Engineer (PF011) have Admin access, which is not required for their roles. This could lead to a potential breach of data.

        3. **Last Login Date**: There are some employees whose last login dates are close to the end of the review period. This could indicate that access reviews are not being conducted regularly.

        **Recommendations**: Initiate a comprehensive review of the access rights assigned to employees. Ensure that all roles have the appropriate access levels and that managerial approval is obtained for any changes. Regularly monitor login activity to detect any anomalies.

        ---
        
        **REVIEW COMPLETION STATUS**
        
        **Failed**: The review identified several critical issues that need to be addressed. Immediate remedial action is recommended.

        ---
        
        **Auditor**: Jane McAllister, CISA, CPA

        **Date**: 07/01/2022

---
**FINANCEFIRST SYSTEM CHANGE REQUEST FORM**

---

**Change Request ID:** FF-SCR-001

**Date:** DD/MM/YYYY

---

**SYSTEM/APPLICATION BEING CHANGED**

**System/Application:** Core Banking System (CBS)

---

**BUSINESS JUSTIFICATION**

The proposed change involves an update to the backend of our Core Banking System (CBS), which is crucial for improving the system's efficiency, security, and compatibility with other fintech solutions.

---

**TECHNICAL DETAILS OF THE CHANGE**

The technical change includes an upgrade to CBS v2.5, which involves:

- Updating the database schema to support new data fields
- Integrating new APIs for enhanced interoperability with third-party systems
- Implementing additional security measures such as two-factor authentication and encrypted data transmission

---

**IMPACT ASSESSMENT**

The change is expected to have a low to medium impact. It may cause temporary downtime during the implementation phase. However, the benefits outweigh the short-term impact as it will enhance system functionality and security.

---

**TESTING PLAN AND RESULTS**

A thorough testing plan has been outlined:

- Unit testing on the new updates in a controlled environment
- Integration testing to ensure compatibility with other systems
- Load testing to ensure system stability under peak load

The results of the test will be documented and presented for review before the implementation phase.

---

**IMPLEMENTATION DATE AND ROLLBACK PROCEDURES**

**Implementation Date:** DD/MM/YYYY

**Rollback Procedures:**

In case of any issues during the implementation phase, the following rollback procedures have been devised:

1. Revert to the previous stable version of CBS
2. Perform data reconciliation to ensure data integrity
3. Re-test and re-validate the system to ensure full functionality

---

**APPROVAL SIGNATURES**

**Technical Approval:**

Name: _________   Signature: _________   Date: _________

**Business Approval:**

Name: _________   Signature: _________   Date: _________

---

Please note that this change request form must be filled out completely and accurately. Failure to do so may result in delays or rejection of the proposed changes. 

---

PayFlow Tech Backup Verification Log
Period: 1st March 2022 – 31st March 2022

----------------------------------------------------------
DAILY BACKUP STATUS
----------------------------------------------------------

Critical System: Payment System
- Backup Success Rate: 97%
- Average Backup Time: 3 hours 45 minutes
- Average File Size: 350 GB
- Integrity Check: Passed on all completed backups
- Failed Backups: 1st March, 4th March (Partial failure due to network issues)

Critical System: Customer Data
- Backup Success Rate: 100%
- Average Backup Time: 5 hours 15 minutes
- Average File Size: 500 GB
- Integrity Check: Passed on all completed backups
- Failed Backups: None

Critical System: Financial Reporting
- Backup Success Rate: 99%
- Average Backup Time: 2 hours 30 minutes
- Average File Size: 150 GB
- Integrity Check: Passed on all completed backups
- Failed Backups: 12th March (Incomplete due to server downtime)

----------------------------------------------------------
OFFSITE BACKUP TRANSFER STATUS
----------------------------------------------------------
- Successful Transfers: 30
- Failed Transfers: 1 (1st March due to network issues)

----------------------------------------------------------
RECOVERY TESTING RESULTS
----------------------------------------------------------
- 1st March: Successful
- 15th March: Successful
- 30th March: Successful

----------------------------------------------------------
SYSTEM ADMINISTRATOR REVIEW
----------------------------------------------------------
All systems show robust backup functionality with minor issues. The payment system experienced two failures due to network issues, and the financial reporting system had one incomplete backup due to server downtime. Recovery tests were successful.

The failed backups were immediately addressed and completed on the following day without incident. Network stability and server uptime will continue to be monitored to prevent future disruptions.

----------------------------------------------------------
SIGN-OFF
----------------------------------------------------------
System Administrator: John Doe
Date: 1st April 2022
Signature: J.D.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS
------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Several access approvals are pending, particularly for critical roles such as Financial Analyst and HR Manager. Recommend immediate follow-up to ensure proper access control.

2. Last login data indicates that some employees may possess outdated access rights. Recommend review and update of access rights in accordance with current role and responsibilities.

3. The Risk Manager's access has not been approved. This could potentially pose a risk to the company. Investigate the reason for lack of approval and rectify immediately.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
REVIEW STATUS
------------------------------------------------------------------------

This review has been completed on March 15, 2022. A follow-up review is scheduled for Q2 2022 to ensure that all recommended actions have been implemented.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

MARKETPLACE INC
SYSTEM CHANGE REQUEST FORM

Change Request ID: MP202150
Date: 15/03/2022

1. SYSTEM/APPLICATION BEING CHANGED
System: Financial Management System
Component: Payment Gateway Integration Module

2. BUSINESS JUSTIFICATION
To enhance the current payment gateway system to support additional payment methods, and improve the checkout process for customers.

3. TECHNICAL DETAILS OF THE CHANGE
Add support for new payment methods (Apple Pay, Google Wallet) in the Payment Gateway Integration Module. This involves updating the payment API to accommodate the new payment methods and modifying the checkout UI to include these options.

4. IMPACT ASSESSMENT
The changes are expected to enhance the customer shopping experience by providing more payment options. However, there may be a temporary disruption during the update process and some customers might encounter issues with transaction processing.

5. TESTING PLAN AND RESULTS
Testing Plan: 
- Unit testing for new API functions
- Integration testing with the checkout UI
- User acceptance testing (UAT) for the new payment methods

Testing Results: 
- Unit testing: Passed
- Integration testing: Passed
- User acceptance testing: Pending

6. APPROVAL SIGNATURES
Technical Approval: 
_____________________________ Date: _________

Business Approval: 
_____________________________ Date: _________

7. IMPLEMENTATION DATE AND ROLLBACK PROCEDURES
Proposed Implementation Date: 22/03/2022

Rollback Procedure: 
Should there be a critical failure with the new update, the system will revert to the last stable version (Version 3.2.1). All payment processes will be maintained on the older version until issues with the new update are resolved.

NOTE: This change request form is incomplete without the required approvals and completed testing results.
